Comment: These same small business owners voted by a large margin for Trump and these policies.
Author: Be-skeptical

Comment: >Major orders canceled. Containers of products left stranded overseas. No roadmap for what comes next.  >The Trump administration [raised tariffs on goods from China to 145% in early April](https://apnews.com/article/trump-tariffs-china-36df035fc02b45e498cc50f213536e79). Since then, small business owners who depend on imports from China to survive have become increasingly desperate as they eye dwindling inventory and skyrocketing invoices.  >President Donald Trump [seemed to back down somewhat last week](https://apnews.com/article/tariffs-trade-taxes-trump-china-bessent-treasury-66668fa26957ece530a250fa8ea19faa) when he said he expected the tariffs to come down “substantially.” That helped set off a rally in the stock market. But for small businesses that operate on razor-thin margins, the back and forth is causing massive upheaval. Some say they could be just months from going out of business altogether.
Author: YesterShill

Comment: They are going out of business. All of them.  People don't yet realize how bad things are going to get.  There are more people than jobs by a few million. What are people going to do when grocery store shelves are empty and there's no jobs?
Author: DragonTHC

Comment: **Kentucky 2024 election results**: Trump garnered 1,337,494 votes (64.47%), while Kamala Harris received 704,043 votes (33.94%). This 30.53-point margin marked Trump's most substantial win in Kentucky to date, surpassing his previous performances in 2016 and 2020. (Vox)  **Michigan 2024 election results**: Donald Trump won Michigan, reclaiming the state for the Republican Party after losing it in 2020. Trump received 2,816,636 votes (49.73%), while Kamala Harris garnered 2,736,533 votes (48.31%). (Wikipedia)  **Oklahoma 2024 election results**: Trump secured a decisive victory in Oklahoma, continuing the state's strong Republican trend. Trump received 1,036,213 votes, accounting for 66.16% of the total, while Kamala Harris garnered 499,599 votes, or 31.90%. (Wikipedia)
Author: ope_poe

Comment: Gosh. It is almost as if voting for a babbling demented traitor has negative consequences.
